Attribute.name: ComponentType
Attribute.HelpText: Type of the component.

Attribute.name: InstanceId
Attribute.HelpText: Name of the Oracle Instance, that this component belongs to

Attribute.name: HostId
Attribute.HelpText: DNS hostname of originating host

Attribute.name: HostNwaddr
Attribute.HelpText: IP or other network address of originating host

Attribute.name: ModuleId
Attribute.HelpText: ID of the module that originated the message. Interpretation is unique within Component ID.

Attribute.name: ProcessId
Attribute.HelpText: ID of the process that originated the message

Attribute.name: OracleHome
Attribute.HelpText: The ORACLE_HOME directory of the component

Attribute.name: HomeInstance
Attribute.HelpText: The ORACLE_INSTANCE directory of the component

Attribute.name: ECID
Attribute.HelpText: Identifies the thread of execution that the originating component participates in.

Attribute.name: RID
Attribute.HelpText: This is the relationship identifier, it is used to provide the full and correct calling relationships between threads and processes.

Attribute.name: ContextFields
Attribute.HelpText: This attribute contains the context fields extracted from dms context.

Attribute.name: SessionId
Attribute.HelpText: ID of the login session.

Attribute.name: TargetComponentType
Attribute.HelpText: This is the target component type.

Attribute.name: ApplicationName
Attribute.HelpText: The J2EE application name

Attribute.name: EventType
Attribute.HelpText: The type of the audit event. Use wlst listAuditEvents to list out all the events.

Attribute.name: EventCategory
Attribute.HelpText: The category of the audit event.

Attribute.name: EventStatus
Attribute.HelpText: The outcome of the audit event - success or failure

Attribute.name: TstzOriginating
Attribute.HelpText: Date and time when the audit event was generated

Attribute.name: ThreadId
Attribute.HelpText: ID of the thread that generated this event

Attribute.name: ComponentName
Attribute.HelpText: The name of this component

Attribute.name: Initiator
Attribute.HelpText: Identifies the UID of the user who is doing the operation

Attribute.name: MessageText
Attribute.HelpText: Description of the audit event

Attribute.name: FailureCode
Attribute.HelpText: The error code in case EventStatus = failure

Attribute.name: RemoteIP
Attribute.HelpText: IP address of the client initiating this event

Attribute.name: Target
Attribute.HelpText: Identifies the UID of the user on whom the operation is being done. E.g. is Alice changes Bob's password, then Alice is the initiator and Bob is the target

Attribute.name: Resource
Attribute.HelpText: Identifies a resource that is being accessed. A resource can be many things - web page, file, directory share, web service, XML document,a portlet. The resource can be named as a combination of a host name, and an URI.

Attribute.name: Roles
Attribute.HelpText: The roles that the user was granted at the time of login.

Attribute.name: DomainName
Attribute.HelpText: The WLS/WebSphere Domain

Attribute.name: ComponentData
Attribute.HelpText: Where component-specific data are stored when there is no component-specific table in the schema

Attribute.name: AuditUser
Attribute.HelpText: Identifies the user name of the user who is running the application

Attribute.name: TenantId
Attribute.HelpText: Tenant ID

Attribute.name: TransactionId
Attribute.HelpText: Transaction ID

Attribute.name: UserTenantId
Attribute.HelpText: User Tenant ID

Category.name: UserSession

Attribute.name: AuthenticationMethod
Attribute.HelpText: The Authentication method - password / SSL / Kerberos etc

Category.HelpText: This set of events is for creating and using user sessions on the system.

Event.name: UserLogin
Event.HelpText: In multi-tier applications, inner tiers often use some special user id (an end user or an administrator) to log in to the next tier. To make audit reports more meaningful, logins by these special users are considered in a separate category - Internal Logins. The User Logins/Logouts category only records actions by regular users (including administrators)

Event.name: UserLogout
Event.HelpText: An end user or administrator logs out.

Event.name: Authentication
Event.HelpText: Authentication is very similar to UserLogin/InternalLogin, except that no session is created, so there is no corresponding UserLogout/InternalLogout. This event is usually generated by lower layers, while login is generated by higher layers.

Event.name: InternalLogin
Event.HelpText: This is an internal login between two tiers.

Event.name: InternalLogout
Event.HelpText: This is an internal logout between two tiers.

Event.name: QuerySession
Event.HelpText: Query the attributes inside a session object for a logged-in user.

Event.name: ModifySession
Event.HelpText: Modify the attributes inside a session object for a logged-in user.

Category.name: Authorization
Category.HelpText: This set of events is for authorization.

Category.name: DataAccess
Category.HelpText: This set of events creates and works with data items.

Event.name: CreateDataItem
Event.HelpText: Create a data item, for example a file.

Event.name: DeleteDataItem
Event.HelpText: Delete a data item

Event.name: QueryDataItemAttributes
Event.HelpText: Query the attributes associated with a data item.

Event.name: ModifyDataItemAttributes
Event.HelpText: Modify the attributes associated with a data item, for example access control, attributes, ownership, and aliases.

Category.name: AccountManagement
Category.HelpText: This set of events is applicable to the management of principal accounts. A principal may be an end-user, or a pseudo-user - a service within the system.

Event.name: ChangePassword
Event.HelpText: Change a user's password

Event.name: CreateAccount
Event.HelpText: Create a user (or group or any other principal) account

Event.name: DeleteAccount
Event.HelpText: Delete an account for a user, group or any other principal

Event.name: DisableAccount
Event.HelpText: Disable an account for a user, group, or any other principal.

Event.name: EnableAccount
Event.HelpText: Enable an account for a user, group, or any other principal.

Event.name: QueryAccount
Event.HelpText: Query the user's account.

Event.name: ModifyAccount
Event.HelpText: Modify account attributes.

Category.name: ServiceManagement
Category.HelpText: This set of events relate to managing system services and applications.

Event.name: InstallService
Event.HelpText: Install or Upgrade a service or an application.

Event.name: RemoveService
Event.HelpText: De-install a service or an application.

Event.name: QueryServiceConfig
Event.HelpText: Query configuration of a service or application.

Event.name: ModifyServiceConfig
Event.HelpText: Configure a service or an application.

Event.name: DisableService
Event.HelpText: Shut down or disable a service or application.

Event.name: EnableService
Event.HelpText: Start up or enable a service or an application.

Category.name: ServiceUtilize
Category.HelpText: These events relate to the use of service and applications. They typically map to the execution of a program or a procedure and manipulation of the processing environment.

Event.name: InvokeService
Event.HelpText: Invoke a service or an application. For example, execute a command line script.

Event.name: TerminateService
Event.HelpText: Terminate a service or an application, either at the instigation of the application itself or by the intervention of the domain in response to user or administrative action.

Event.name: QueryProcessContext
Event.HelpText: Query the attributes associated with the current processing context

Event.name: ModifyProcessContext
Event.HelpText: Modify the attributes associated with the current processing context

Category.name: PeerAssocManagement
Category.HelpText: This set of events creates and works with communication channels between system components.

Event.name: CreatePeerAssoc
Event.HelpText: Create a communication channel between system components

Event.name: TerminatePeerAssoc
Event.HelpText: Terminate a communication channel between system components

Event.name: QueryAssocContext
Event.HelpText: Query attributes associated with a communication channel between system components

Event.name: ModifyAssocContent
Event.HelpText: Modify attributes associated with a communication channel between system components

Event.name: ReceiveDataViaAssoc
Event.HelpText: Receive data from associated peer

Event.name: SendDataViaAssoc
Event.HelpText: Send data to associated peer

Category.name: DataItemContentAccess
Category.HelpText: These events are for forming an association between a service or application and a data item or resource element in order to use its contents or services - for example, a file or directory, device special file, memory segment, communications port, etc.

Event.name: CreateDataItemAssoc
Event.HelpText: Open a data item, for example a file.

Event.name: TerminateDataItemAssoc
Event.HelpText: Close a data item, for example a file.

Event.name: QueryDataItemAssocContext
Event.HelpText: Query attributes of a data item, for example mode of access, size limits, access path, etc.

Event.name: ModifyDataItemAssocContext
Event.HelpText: Modify attributes of a data item

Event.name: QueryDataItemContents
Event.HelpText: Read the data item.

Event.name: ModifyDataItemContent
Event.HelpText: Write/Append the data item

Category.name: Exceptional
Category.HelpText: These are events that are considered to be outside the generalized events.

Event.name: StartSystem
Event.HelpText: Boot a system host.

Event.name: ShutdownSystem
Event.HelpText: Shut down the system.

Event.name: ResourceExhausted
Event.HelpText: Resources like data storage resources, communication end points have been exhausted.

Event.name: ResourceCorrupted
Event.HelpText: Resources such as data storage resources have integrity failures.

Event.name: BackupDatastore
Event.HelpText: Make a backup copy of a data store.

Event.name: RecoverDatastore
Event.HelpText: Recover a data store from a backup copy.

Category.name: AuditService

Attribute.name: TransactionId
Attribute.HelpText: Transaction ID

Category.HelpText: This set of events applies to audit configuration.

Event.name: ConfigureAuditPolicy
Event.HelpText: Modify parameters that control auditing, for example change the audit filtering.

Event.name: ConfigureAuditRepository
Event.HelpText: Configure the Audit Repository, for example change a file repository to a database repository.

FilterPresetDefinition.name: Low
FilterPresetDefinition.helpText: Low filter preset .To be defined by the component

FilterPresetDefinition.name: Medium
FilterPresetDefinition.helpText: Medium filter preset. To be defined by the component

FilterPresetDefinition.name: High
FilterPresetDefinition.helpText: High filter preset. To be defined by the component
